CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial
JUDGES: Giovanni Bonello;Ján Šikuta;Lech Garlicki;Ledi Bianku;Nicolas Bratza;Päivi Hirvelä
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in PERSON .
CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the applicant ’s wife filed a petition for divorce . The divorce was granted shortly afterwards .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged a claim for the division of matrimonial property with ORG ( FAC ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG gave a decision and divided the property .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the applicant appealed .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( PERSON ) remitted the case .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG again gave a decision .
CARDINAL . On unspecified dates both parties appealed .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed both appeals .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged a cassation appeal with ORG ( Sąd Najwyższy ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG refused to hear the applicant ’s cassation appeal .
CARDINAL . The applicant submitted that as a consequence of the prolonged proceedings in his case he had been deprived of his property and had to live in a Welfare Home ( PERSON ) .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the applicant instituted enforcement proceedings against his wife who apparently had failed to comply with the final decision on the division of their property .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG informed the applicant that the enforcement had proved ineffective .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged a complaint with ORG against the actions taken by the bailiff ( skarga na czynności komornika ) . He submitted that those actions had been incorrect , because the money obtained from the debtor had been distributed wrongly . He also complained about the ineffectiveness of the enforcement .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed his complaint . It held that the order of distribution had been in accordance with LAW . As regards the ineffectiveness of the enforcement , the court held that no valuable objects had been found in the debtor ’s house which could be sold and used to satisfy the debt .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the applicant appealed .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed his appeal .

CARDINAL . The legal provisions applicable before the entry into force of LAW as well as matters of practice concerning the remedies against unreasonable length of proceedings are set out in paragraphs CARDINAL of the judgment delivered by ORG DATE in the case of PERSON v. GPE no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL .

CARDINAL . The relevant domestic law and practice concerning remedies for the excessive length of judicial proceedings , in particular the applicable provisions of LAW , are stated in the ORG ’s decisions in the cases of ORG v. GPE no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ( dec . ) , § § DATE , ECHR CARDINAL-V ; NORP v. GPE no . CARDINAL ( dec . ) , ORG CARDINAL-VIII ; and the judgment in the case of ORG v. GPE , no . CARDINAL , § § DATE , ECHR CARDINAL-V.
